item.description:
Hi, Everybody -

Best enjoyed by those who do not have a day end deadline, this day sounds perfect for a great hike, bird watch, and picnic in the wilderness areas surrounding the Ipswich River!

The weather looks to be fine, but as has been typical this summer, may be warm and humid.

Here is the link to the Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary:

http://www.massaudubo...

The hike starts at 9:30 and ends around 1:30 approximately. Estimate about 3 - 3 1/2 hours of hiking covering 5 - 6 miles and 1/2 hour to 45 minutes to relax and enjoy the picnic, which will be in the woods. I would recommend packing your picnic lunch in a cold pack or with dry ice to keep it cold, since we'll be stopping for the picnic about halfway through our hike.

Please bring bug spray and beverages....camera and binoculars if you have them, are great!

The directions that are on the web site are fine; only thing being that you have to look carefully for a very small white sign on the turn off Route 97 - and again for the turn into the wildlife center, which is about another mile or so after you make that turn. The address is 87 Perkins Row (not Perkins Lane). The street numbers are odd - they go up and then back down again! Just send me an e-mail if you have any questions.

Please note that the sanctuary does charge a $4 per person entrance fee. For those who wish to carpool, there is a convenient Park and Ride lot which is located at Exit 57 off Route 95, which is the Newburyport / West Newbury / Route 113 ramp.

I will look forward to seeing you then!

Randy
RandyS@maine.rr.com
item.how_to_find_us: Once you turn left into the parking lot, go straight and turn right towards the back and look for a silver Subaru Forester. We will meet near there.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike and Picnic Lunch in Ipswich!
